stimulusHtml:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The two images show a view and a plan of the same building.

Using two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how this work demonstrates continuity with earlier architectural traditions.

Using two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how this work demonstrates change from earlier architectural traditions.

Using two examples of specific contextual evidence, explain why the architect chose to reference earlier architectural traditions.
